text: The Kollimalai bush frog (Raorchestes kollimalai) is a frog. It lives in India. Scientists have seen it exactly one place in the Western Ghat mountains, about 1100 meters above sea level. The adult male frog is 15â€“45 mm long from nose to rear end. The skin of the frog's back is light brown with darker brown spots and marks. There is a dark brown stripe on each side of its head. The stripe goes from the eye over the ear to the frog's shoulder. The pupil of the eye is black in color with gold in it. Scientists named this frog Kollimalai after the place where they found it. ==References== Category:Frogs of Asia
title: Raorchestes kollimalai
